trans-unit.source: Represents the collection containing the indexes to the checked items in a list view control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> stores the indexes to the checked items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Items can be checked only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckBoxes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to `true`.
The indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> are index positions within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

The following table is an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> as well as their checked states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Index
Item
Checked state in the ListView
Item1
Unchecked
Item2
Checked
Item3
Unchecked
Item4
Checked
Item5
Checked

Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> would appear.
Index
Index of checked item in ListViewItemCollection
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.

Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control that owns the collection.
Determines whether the specified index is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an index position from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is one of the checked indexes stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.

Once you know that an item is in the checked index collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.
The index to locate in the collection.

`true` if the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is an item in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of checked items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the checked index collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the checked index collection.

Returns the index within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> of the specified index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> of the list view control.

Once you know that an item is in the checked index collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the index in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.
The zero-based index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> to locate in the collection.

The zero-based index in the collection where the specified index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> is located within the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>; otherwise, -1 if the index is not located in the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `true` for this collection.
The items in the collection can only be modified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the index value at the specified index within the collection.
This indexer enables you to get a specific index from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>.

The index stored in the collection is an index into the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a checked item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
The index value from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> that is stored at the specified location.
The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of .
Copies the collection of checked-item indexes into an array.
The array must contain 32-bit signed integers, or it must be an <xref:System.Object> array.
An array of type <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
The zero-based index in the array at which copying begins.
The array type cannot be cast to an <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.
To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CheckedListBox.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A> property.
The object to add to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The zero-based index where value is located in the collection.
Always thrown.
Removes all items from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.

To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A> property to `false` for each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
Always thrown.
Checks whether the index corresponding with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> is checked.
An index to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
`true` if the index is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index of the specified object in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The zero-based index from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> to locate in the collection.

The zero-based index in the collection where the specified index of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> is located if it is in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.
To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A> property.
The index at which value should be inserted.
The object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref> has a fixed size.
`true` in all cases.
Gets or sets an object in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
The object from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection"></xref> that is stored at the specified location.
Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A> property.
The object to be removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Removes an item from the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedIndexCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A> property.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Always thrown.
